National Ukraine (UA) Destination India (IN)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid on arrival. Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Visitors with a non-machine readable passport are not allowed to enter. - This does not apply to visitors with a valid visa. Visa required, except for Passengers with an Overseas Citizen
of India" card or booklet. Visa required, except for Passengers with a "Person of Indian Origin" card. Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine with a normal
passport arriving at Ahmedabad (AMD), Amritsar (ATQ), Bengaluru (BLR), Chennai (MAA), Delhi (DEL), Gaya (GAY), Goa (GOI), Hyderabad (HYD), Jaipur (JAI), Kochi (COK), Kolkata (CCU), Lucknow (LKO), Mumbai (BOM), Thiruvananthapuram (TRV), Tiruchirapalli (TRZ), or Varanasi (VNS) can obtain a single-entry e-Tourist visa before departure at https://indianvisaonline.gov.in/ for a maximum stay of 30 days. Passengers must Additional Information:
- Indian law does not permit dual nationality for nationals of
India. - U visas are no longer issued to those who have been granted Overseas Citizenship of India (OCI) status.
- Passengers with a Registration Certificate/Residential
Permit must also travel with the supporting documents
allowing them to stay in India, e.g. PIO. - Indian visa stickers have no seal/signature from the issuing
authority. (SEE NOTE 57490) NOTE 57490: This does not apply to passengers with a PIO card. - Nationals of Ukraine being of Pakistani origin (those born
in Pakistan or whose parents or grandparents were born in Pakistan) holding multiple entry Tourist Visas (type T),
with a validity ranging from above 3 months and up to 10 years, are required to have at least 60 days between visits. (SEE NOTE 54918) NOTE 54918: Those wishing to re-enter before the 60 days have expired must contact an Indian mission abroad to obtain permission. - Visa extensions possible, except for "T" (tourist) visas and Transit visas, by applying at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. (SEE NOTE 57490) NOTE 57490: This does not apply to passengers with a PIO card. - Valid visas in expired passports are still acceptable,
provided accompanied by a valid passport of the same nationality of the expired passport.
- Holders of visas that specifically state the city/airport of entry must enter India at the specified city/airport. (SEE NOTE 57490) NOTE 57490: This does not apply to passengers with a PIO card. - Nationals of Ukraine, belonging to a Tourist Group
(SEE NOTE 57490) NOTE 57490: This does not apply to passengers with a PIO card. - Restricted/Protected Areas permits: a permit is required for foreigners wishing to visit the following: Warning: - Visitors holding tourist or business visas must hold return/onward tickets. (SEE NOTE 57490) (SEE NOTE 57548)
NOTE 57490: This does not apply to passengers with a PIO card. NOTE 57548: Not applicable to holders of multiple entry
visa, issued for validity period of at least 1 year. Not applicable to holders of any other type of visa.

Health information - Destination

India (IN)
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to quarantine for 6 days. Quarantine facilities are
only available at Delhi (DEL), Chennai (MAA) and Mumbai (BOM). At other airports passengers will be deported. Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 6 months of age. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk (P. vivax and P. falciparum) exists in the whole country below 2000 meters. There is no transmission in parts of the states of Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir and Sikkim. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Bangladesh (BD)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid on arrival. Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine with a
return/onward ticket and traveling as tourists can obtain a
visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 30 days. They can apply to extend their stay. Additional Information:
- Holders of passports or travel documents endorsed with a "No Visa Required" stamp issued by Bangladesh are exempt from holding a visa. - Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
Warning: - Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
entry.

Health information - Destination

Bangladesh (BD)
Vaccinations not required.
Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk exists throughout the year but transmission only occurs in rural areas of some districts, with a varying degree of risk. However, most parts of the country, including Dhaka City, have no risk of malaria. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

National Ukraine (UA) Destination Pakistan (PK)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid on arrival. Visa required, except for Passengers with a Pakistan origin card (POC) or a national ID card for overseas Pakistanis
(NICOP) for an unlimited period of stay. Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine traveling on
business can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 30 days if they have a confirmation that a visa has been approved
before departure. They must: Visa required, except for Passengers with Pakistani origins can obtain a temporary landing permit for 72 hours. They must: Additional Information:
- Extension of stay is possible; to be applied for at the Ministry of Interior. - Visitors who overstay Warning: - Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
entry. - Exempt are holders of a Pakistan Origin Card (POC), holders of a National Identity Card for Overseas Pakistanis
(NICOP), holders of passports containing a "Visa exempt" stamp issued by Pakistan and passengers having dual nationality and using Pakistan passport.

Health information - Destination

Pakistan (PK)
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to quarantine for 6 days.
Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age if the mother's vaccination
certificate shows that she has been duly vaccinated prior to
the birth of the child. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Warning: - Vaccination against Polio prior to departure from Pakistan
required for all nationals and residents of Pakistan, and
for visitors staying in Pakistan for more than 4 weeks. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk (P. vivax and P. falciparum) exists throughout the year in the whole country below 2000 meters, especially in rural areas from July to December. Recommended prevention: C.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Mexico (MX)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid on arrival. Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Passengers with a non-machine readable passport are not allowed to enter or transit Mexico. - This does not apply to passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine with a normal
or emergency passport for a maximum stay of 180 days. (SEE NOTE 40646); NOTE 40646: Before departure, an on-line authorization
from the Electronic Authorization System (SAE) must be
obtained at Visa required, except for Passengers with a valid visa issued by Canada, Japan, USA, United Kingdom or a Schengen Member State for a maximum stay of 180 days. Minors: - Passport not required for alien minors (up to/incl.17 years of age) registered in their parent/guardian passport, provided traveling with the passport holder. - All minors under 14 years of age, when traveling alone, should be met by an adult. Additional Information:
- A valid Mexican visa in an expired passport is accepted if the passenger also has a valid passport. Warning: - Visitors not holding return/onward tickets co uld be refused entry.

Health information - Destination

Mexico (MX)
Vaccinations not required.
Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, almost exclusively due to P. vivax, is intermittently present throughout the year in some rural areas that are not often visited by tourists. There is low risk of transmission in some localities in the
Chiapas State, with very low risk in the states of Chihuahua, Durango, Nayarit, Quintana Roo and Sinaloa. Recommended prevention in moderate risk areas: A.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Viet Nam (VN)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. - Without a visa, passports and other documents accepted for entry issued to nationals of Ukraine must be valid for a
minimum of 30 days beyond the period of intended stay. - With a visa, passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 30 days beyond the expiry date of the visa. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine arriving at Phu
Quoc (PQC) for a maximum stay of 30 days. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine arriving at
Hanoi (HAN) or Ho Chi Minh City (SGN) with onward tickets for
a connecting flight, on the same day, to Phu Quoc (PQC). They
must clear immigration at Hanoi (HAN) or Ho Chi Minh City
(SGN) where they will be granted a maximum stay of 30 days and transfer to domestic terminal for a connecting flight to Phu
Quoc (PQC). Visa required, except for Passengers with a Certificate of
Visa Exemption issued by Viet Nam for a maximum stay of 90
days. - OR Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Passengers with a confirmation
letter that a visa has been approved before departure and issued in Hanoi (HAN) by the Vietnamese Immigration (Ministry
of Public Security) or the Consular Department (Ministry of Foreign Affairs) can obtain a visa on arrival at Hanoi (HAN), Ho Chi Minh City (SGN), Da Nang (DAD) or Nha Trang (CXR). Minors: - Minors arriving in or departing from Viet Nam who are 13
years old or younger must hold proof of being met by parent or guardian at the airport of arrival. Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
- Extension of stay possible for an additional 90 days, for
holders of a Certificate of Visa Exemption .
Warning: - Visa exempt visitors not holding return/onward tickets could
be refused entry.

Health information - Destination

Viet Nam (VN)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission . Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. falciparum, exists in the whole country, excluding urban centres, the Red River Delta, the Mekong Delta and the coastal plain areas of central Viet Nam. High risk areas are the highland areas below 1500 m. south of 18N, notably the four central highlands provinces of Dak Lak, Dak Nong, Gia Lai and Kon Tum, Binh Phuoc province and the western parts of the coastal provinces Khanh Hoa, Ninh Thuan , Quang Nam and Quang Tri. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Peru (PE)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid on arrival. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine with a normal
passport traveling as tourists for a maximum stay of 183 days. Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
Warning: - Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
entry.

Health information - Destination

Peru (PE)
Vaccinations not required.
Recommended: - Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers of 9
months of age and older visiting jungle areas below 2300
meters in Peru. Travelers who will only visit the cities of
Cuzco and Lima, Machu Picchu and the Inca trail and some areas west of the Andes, do not need vaccination.
Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk (P. vivax and P. falciparum) exists throughout the year in rural areas at altitudes below 2000 meters. The 23 highest risk districts
are concentrated in the departments of Ayacucho, Junin, Loreto, Madre de Dios, Piura, San Martin and Tumbes. Most P.
falciparum cases are reported from Loreto. Recommended prevention: B in P. vivax risk areas; C in department of
Loreto.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Philippines (PH)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. - Former nationals of the Philippines, their immediate family
members and immediate family members of nationals of the
Philippines must hold passports valid on arrival. Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Visitors with a non-machine readable passport are not allowed to enter. Visa required. Minors: - Foreign minors traveling accompanied by parents - Foreign minors younger than 15 years, not residing in the Philippines and traveling without parents require a Waiver of Exclusion Ground (WEG) Additional Information:
- Visitors must have proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
- Length of stay is calculated by starting on the next day
after the day of arrival in the Philippines. Warning: - Visitors traveling for touristic or business purposes must
hold return/onward tickets:
- This does not apply to former nationals of the Philippines
(Balikbayans) and accompanying spouses and children. - This does not apply to passengers with TRV, 9(d), 9(e), 9(f), 9(g), SEVUA, PD1034, EO226, RA8756, 13, 13(a), 13(c), 13(e), 13(g) or PRV visas issued by the Philippines.

Health information - Destination

Philippines (PH)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission . Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age who are, however, subject to isolation or surveillance when indicated.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk exists throughout the year in areas below 600 meters, except in the provinces of Aklan, Albay, Benguet, Bilaran, Bohol, Camiguin, Capiz, Catanduanes, Cavite, Cebu, Guimaras, Iloilo, Northern/Southern Leyte, Marinduque, Masbate, Eastern/Northern/Western Samar, Sequijor, Sorsogon, Surigao Del Norte and metropolitan Manila. No risk considered to exist in urban areas or in the plains. Human P. knowlesi infection reported in the province of Palawan. Recommended
prevention in risk areas: C.
info:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date.
 - Former nationals of the Philippines, their immediate family
   members and immediate family members of nationals of the
   Philippines must hold passports valid on arrival.
   
Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. 
Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Visitors with a non-machine readable passport are not
  allowed to enter. 

Visa required.

Minors:
- Foreign minors traveling accompanied by parents
   
- Foreign minors younger than 15 years, not residing in the
  Philippines and traveling without parents require a Waiver
  of Exclusion Ground (WEG)  
Additional Information:
- Visitors must have proof of sufficient funds to cover their
  stay and documents required for their next destination. 
- Length of stay is calculated by starting on the next day
  after the day of arrival in the Philippines. 
Warning:
- Visitors traveling for touristic or business purposes must
  hold return/onward tickets:
 - This does not apply to former nationals of the Philippines
   (Balikbayans) and accompanying spouses and children. 
 - This does not apply to passengers with TRV, 9(d), 9(e),
   9(f), 9(g), SEVUA, PD1034, EO226, RA8756, 13, 13(a), 13(c),
   13(e), 13(g) or PRV visas issued by the Philippines
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age who are, however, subject to
  isolation or surveillance when indicated.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission if not leaving the transit areas. 
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk exists throughout the year
  in areas below 600 meters, except in the provinces of Aklan,
  Albay, Benguet, Bilaran, Bohol, Camiguin, Capiz,
  Catanduanes, Cavite, Cebu, Guimaras, Iloilo,
  Northern/Southern Leyte, Marinduque, Masbate,
  Eastern/Northern/Western Samar, Sequijor, Sorsogon, Surigao
  Del Norte and metropolitan Manila. No risk considered to
  exist in urban areas or in the plains. Human P. knowlesi
  infection reported in the province of Palawan. Recommended
  prevention in risk areas: C.

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with a temporary passport. Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Passengers with a handwritten passport are not allowed to enter. Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Passengers traveling as tourist can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 90 days. (SEE NOTE 56906) NOTE 56906: Not applicable to nationals of Ukraine
traveling with a temporary passport, who must obtain a visa prior to travel. Visa required, except for Passengers traveling on business can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 5 years, if holding a license issued by the Ministry of Industry. (SEE NOTE 56906) NOTE 56906: Not applicable to nationals of Ukraine
traveling with a temporary passport, who must obtain a visa prior to travel. Additional Information:
- Extension of tourist stay (up to 150 days)

Health information - Destination

Nepal (NP)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission . Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax, exists throughout the year in rural areas of the Terai districts bordering with India, with occasional outbreaks of P. falciparum from July to October inclusive. Seasonal transmission of P. vivax takes place in districts of the inner Terai and midhills. Recommended prevention in risk
areas: C.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Brazil (BR)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for the period of intended stay. Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. - Passengers with a Laissez-Passer issued by Brazil. Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Passengers with a handwritten passport are not allowed to enter. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine with a normal
passport for a maximum stay of 90 days. (SEE NOTE 52727) NOTE 52727: The maximum stay is granted within 180 days. Additional Information:
- The validity of long term (1, 3 and 5 years) tourist and business visas starts on the day of issuance. - Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
- Passengers registered in passport of companion must hold an individual visa. - A valid visa in an expired passport is accepted if: - Holders of multiple entry Temp V visa issued by Brazil
must:. Warning: - Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
entry. - Exempt are holders of a "VIPER" visa issued by Brazil.

Health information - Destination

Brazil (BR)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting Angola and Congo (Dem. Rep.).
Recommended: - Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers of 9
months of age and older visiting areas where transmission
risk exists, including rural areas in: Acre, Amapa, Amazonas, Distrito Federal (incl. the capital city of Brasilia), Goias, Maranhao, Mato Grosso, Mato Grosso do Sul, Minas Gerais, Para, Rondonia, Roraima, Tocantins, and to
other state areas where transmission risk exists including all the states of Minas Gerais and specific areas of Bahia, Parana, Piaui, Rio Grande do Sul, Santa Catarina and Sao Paulo states. Vaccination is also recommended for travelers
visiting Iguazu Falls. The complete list of municipalities
are available at www.saude.gov.br/svs05 - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk is negligible in the states outside the administrative region of the Amazones.
Malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax but also P. falciparum exists in most forested areas below 900 meters of the Amazon region. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

Health information - Destination

Ecuador (EC)
Vaccinations not required.
Recommended: - Vaccination against yellow fever if being 9 months or older
traveling to the following provinces east of the Andes at altitudes below 2300 meters: Morona-Santiago, Napo,

region. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Bolivia (BO)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid on arrival. - Emergency or temporary passports must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Passengers with an invitation letter
issued by the Bolivian Immigration Authorities (DIGEMIG) or a
hotel reservation confirmation can obtain a visa on arrival
for a maximum stay of 90 days if having: - a passport valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date and -1 passport photo. Minors: - Unaccompanied passengers under 18 years of age are required to Additional Information:
- Dual nationality is recognized by Bolivia, however
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
- For holders of normal passports the max. stay is granted within one year. Extension of stay possible. Warning: - Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
entry.

Health information - Destination

Bolivia (BO)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if traveling to the
following areas east of the Andes at altitudes below 2300
meters: the entire Depts. of Beni and Pando, and designated
areas of the departments of Chuquisaca, Cochabamba, La Paz, Santa Cruz and Tarija. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis. Malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax, exists throughout the year in the whole country below 2500 meters with P. falciparum present in Santa Cruz and Beni and Pando departments. Recommended prevention in risk areas: B;
in Beni, Pando and Santa Cruz: C.

Kenya (KE)
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission or Sao Tome and Principe, Somalia or Tanzania. Passengers not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate
are subject to quarantine for 6 days.
Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Recommended: - Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers over 9
months of age visiting any area outside the main cities in
Kenya. - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole country. There is normally little risk in the city of Nairobi and in the highlands (above 2500 meters.) of Central, Rift Valley, Eastern, Nyanza and Western Provinces. Recommended prevention: C.

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry issued to nationals of Ukraine must be valid for a minimum of 3 months
from the arrival date. Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine for a maximum
stay of 90 days. Minors: - Passport not required for minors under 18 years of age, if: - Up to and incl. 17 years of age Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
Warning: - Visitors must hold return/onward tickets . - Exempt are holders of foreign passports stating Costa Rica
as place of birth. - Exempt are holders of a Resolution of Approval , Assignment
Notification or Post Assignment Travel Authorization.

Health information - Destination

Costa Rica (CR)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting Angola, Benin, Bolivia,
Brazil, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cameroon, Central African Rep., Chad, Colombia, Congo, Congo (Dem. Rep.), Cote d'Ivoire, Ecuador, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, Ethiopia, French Guiana, Gabon, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Kenya, Liberia, Mali, Mauritania, Niger, Nigeria, Peru, Sao Tome and Principe, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, South Sudan, Sudan, Tanzania, Togo, Trinidad & Tobago, Uganda, Venezuela and Zambia. Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age and adults above 60 years of age. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. - Expectant mothers (or when in the breast feeding period) and those holding a proof of medical contraindication.
Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk mainly due to P. vivax. Negligible or no risk of malaria transmission exists, except for very low risk in the canton of Matina, Limon Province.
Recommended prevention in risk areas: A.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Iraq (IQ)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 6 months beyond the period of intended stay. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 3 months beyond the period of intended stay when arriving at Basra (BSR). - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid on arrival when arriving at Erbil (EBL) or Sulaymaniyah (ISU). Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Passengers with a handwritten passport are not allowed to enter. Visa required, except for Passengers with a signed and stamped letter issued by the Ministry of Interior of Iraq if arriving at Baghdad (BGW), Basra (BSR) or Najaf (NJF) . Visa required, except for Passengers with a signed and stamped letter issued by the Ministry of Interior of the Kurdistan Regional Government if arriving at Erbil (EBL) and Sulaymaniyah (ISU) Visa required, except for Passengers arriving at Baghdad (BGW), Basra (BSR) or Najaf (NJF) whose passport states Iraq as place of birth. They must have an original and official Iraqi document with the same name as on the passport. Visa required, except for Passengers married to a national of
Iraq arriving at Najaf (NJF) for a maximum stay of 3 months. They must have an original Iraqi marriage certificate or an
approved marriage certificate issued by an Iraqi embassy.
Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Business managers, investors, international experts, oil company managers or representatives
traveling on business can obtain a visa on arrival at Basra (BSR) if holding return/onward tickets and passports valid at
least 6 months from date of arrival . Visa required, except for Passengers younger than 18 years can obtain a visa on arrival at Baghdad (BGW) or Basra (BSR) airports. They must travel with their parents and at least one of the parents must hold an Iraqi passport. Visa required, except for Passengers with a proof of being of Iraqi origin or having Iraqi parents can obtain a visa on arrival. They must have an original and official Iraqi document with the same name as on the passport. Additional Information:
- Group visas - Passengers with a visa issued in paper format are not allowed to enter Najaf (NJF). Warning: - Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa will be refused entry in Iraq. This restriction does not
apply at Erbil (EBL). - Passports and/or passport replacing documents of all visitors traveling to Baghdad (BGW) or Basra (BSR) must contain at least 2 unused visa pages - Passports and/or passport replacing documents of all visitors traveling to Najaf (NJF) must contain at least 3 unused visa pages - Passengers who have visited Congo (Dem. Rep.), Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria, Senegal and Sierra Leone within 3 months prior to arrival in Iraq are subject to screening and health check. Exempt are holders of diplomatic passports.

Health information - Destination

Iraq (IQ)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission . Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 6 months of age. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, exclusively to P. vivax, is limited and may exist from May to November inclusive in areas in the north below 1500 meters (Duhok, Erbil and Sulaimaniya provinces). Recommended prevention in risk
areas: none.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination Malaysia (MY)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. Passport Exemptions:
- Nationals of Ukraine with a Travel Document of a Child
issued by Ukraine. - Passengers with a Certificate of Identity issued by
Malaysia. - Passengers with an emergency or a temporary passport. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine for a maximum
stay of 30 days. (SEE NOTE 64252) (SEE NOTE 64255) NOTE 64252: This does not apply to passengers with a temporary passport. NOTE 64255: This does not apply to passengers with an emergency passport. Minors: - Minors up to and including 15 years of age may be listed in an accompanying adult's passport. Additional Information:
- Extensions of stay possible for nationals of Ukraine.
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds of at least USD 100.- per day to cover their stay. - Students Warning: - Passports and passport replacing documents of all non-Malaysian nationals must contain at least 1 unused page
- Nationals of Ukraine not holding a return/onward ticket
could be requested to purchase one or refused entry.

Health information - Destination

Malaysia (MY)
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to quarantine for 6 days.
Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis. Malaria risk exists in limited areas in the deep hinterland of the states of Sabah and Sarawak and central areas of Peninsular Malaysia. Urban, suburban and coastal areas are free from malaria. Human P. knowlesi infection reported. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

risk areas: B; areas bordering Colombia: C.

vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving from
Brazil. Passengers must have a vaccination certificate issued
at least 10 days before arrival. 

Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for passengers of 9 months
  of age and older traveling to all mainland areas east of the
  Canal Zone, (the entire comarcas of Embera and Kuna Yala,
  the province of Darien and areas of the provinces of Colon
  and Panama that are east of the Canal Zone.
  Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax
  exists throughout the year in provinces and Comarcas along
  the Atlantic coast and the borders with Costa Rica and
  Colombia: Bocas del Toro, Chiriqui, Colon, Darien, Kuna
  Yala, Ngabe Bugle, Panama and Veraquas. In Panama City, the
  Canal Zone, and in the other provinces there is no or
  negligible risk of transmission. Recommended prevention in
  risk areas: B; areas bordering Colombia: C.

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. Visa required. Minors: - Minors younger than 1 year with their own passport can obtain a visa on arrival if traveling with one parent. The parent must have a residence permit issued by Saudi Arabia. Additional Information:
- Muslim female passengers arriving to perform Umrah or Hajj must be - Visitors are required to comply with local laws in respect of general appearance and behavior. Those not complying could be refused entry. - Nationals and residents of Saudi Arabia who have visited
Guinea, Liberia or Sierra Leone within the last 21 days are subject to screening and health checks. Passengers may be quarantined for further assessment.
- A pilgrim visa is worded in the Arab language only. Business and visitors' visas are bilingual (Arabic/English). - Visitors are required to hold documents required for their next destination.
- Valid visas in expired passports Warning: - WARNING FOR PILGRIMS! - Passengers who have visited Guinea, Liberia or Sierra Leone within the last 21 days will be refused entry. - Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
entry.

Health information - Destination

Saudi Arabia (SA)
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to vaccination upon arrival and quarantine. (SEE NOTE
11460). NOTE 11460: Infected areas in Sudan are south of latitude
15 degrees. Certificate from local Sudanese health
authorities is required, indicating that passengers have not
visited these infected areas during the last 6 days prior to departure. Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission if not leaving the transit areas. Warning: - Vaccination for Meningitis required for:
- Hajis and Umrah passengers (SEE NOTE 24666). NOTE 24666: The date of vaccination should be not more
than 3 years and not less than 10 days from the date of arrival in Saudi Arabia. Passenger not holding Meningitis
vaccination certificate, if required, will be vaccinated
upon arrival or quarantined.
Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. falciparum is limited and exists mainly from September to January in areas along the southern border with Yemen (except in the high altitude areas of Asir Province). No
risk in Mecca or Medina cities. Recommended prevention in
risk areas: C. - Pilgrims are strongly advised to be vaccinated against human influenza, particularly those with medical conditions,
susceptible to medical complications, and the elderly.

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination St. Maarten (SX)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 3 months beyond the period of intended stay. Visa required, except for Passengers with a valid "D" visa issued by a Schengen Member State for a maximum stay of 90 days. Visa required, except for Passengers with a multiple-entry C
visa issued by a Schengen Member State and valid for the period of intended stay. They are exempt for a maximum stay of 90 days. Visa required, except for Passengers transiting overland to
the French part of St. Martin for a maximum stay of 48 hours.
They must have documents required for entry into French West Indies and a hotel reservation.
Minors: - Must be escorted or met by an adult residing in St. Maarten upon arrival. Additional Information:
- On 10 October 2010, the Netherlands Antilles have been
dissolved. St. Maarten will continue as an independent
country within the Kingdom of the Netherlands (similar to the status of Aruba). - Visitors must provide an address (place of stay) in St. Maarten, proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
- Holders of a visa issued by Canada, USA or a Schengen Member State are granted a max. stay of 90 days within one calendar year in the Kingdom of the Netherlands in the Caribbean (Aruba, Curacao, Bonaire, St. Eustasius and Saba, St. Maarten). Warning: - Nationals and residents of St. Maarten arriving from Congo
(Dem. Rep.), Guinea, Liberia or Sierra Leone or who have visited those countries within the last 21 days will be quarantined for at least 21 days upon arrival.
- Passengers who have visited or have transited Congo (Dem. Rep.), Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria or Sierra Leone within the last 21 days will be refused entry and transit. - Visitors not holding return/onward tickets co uld be refused entry.

Health information - Destination

fullText:
National Ukraine (UA) Destination South Africa (ZA)

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for a minimum of 30 days beyond the period of intended stay. Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Passengers with a non-machine readable passport are not allowed to enter or transit. Visa required. Minors: - Minors younger than 18 years, traveling to/from South Africa: - This does not apply to holders of a valid visa. - This does not apply to minors if the information about both
parents is included in the passport or other official travel documents of the minor. Additional Information:
- South Africa does not accept loose leaf Temporary Travel Documents. - Extension of stay for additional 90 days is possible, if
- Visa labels starting with control numbers B0028 and B0029
are fraudulent. Holders of these visa labels contained in their passport or other official travel document will be refused entry. - Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents for their next destination.
Warning: - Passports and passport replacing documents of all non-South African nationals must contain at least 1 unused visa page
- Extended machine readable passports are not accepted. - Visitors must hold return/onward tickets . - Visitors arriving without a return or onward ticket

Health information - Destination

South Africa (ZA)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving from
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission . The certificate will become valid 10 days after vaccination
and will stay valid for life. Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age. - Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
transmission for max. 12 hours and not leaving the transit area. - Passengers transiting Senegal and Ghana but not leaving the
aircraft. - Holders of a certificate of contraindication on medical
grounds, who will be placed under quarantine.
Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. falciparum, exists throughout the year in the low altitude
areas of Limpopo Province, Mpumalanga Province (including the Kruger National Park) and north-eastern Kwazulu Natal as
far south as the Tugela river. Risk is highest from October to May. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.

Health information - Destination

Venezuela (VE)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving from
Brazil. Passengers must have a vaccination certificate issued
at least 10 days before arrival. Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months. Recommended: - Vaccination against yellow fever for passengers over 9
months of age. - for passengers visiting any area outside the main cities in
Venezuela; - Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax, is moderate to high throughout the year in some rural areas of Amazonas, Anzoategui, Bolivar and Delta Amacuro states. There is low risk in Apure, Monagas, Sucre and Zulia. Risk of P. falciparum malaria is restricted to municipalities in
jungle areas of Amazonas (Alta Orinoco, Atabapo, Atures, Autana, Manapiare) and Bolivar (Cedeno, El Callao, Heres, Gran Sabana, Piar, Raul Leoni, Rocio, Sifontes and Sucre). Recommended prevention: B in P. vivax risk areas; C in P.
falciparum risk areas.

Information for Normal Passports

Passport required. - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be valid for the period of intended stay. Passport Exemptions:
- Passengers with a machine-readable temporary or emergency passport. Visa Issuance: Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine traveling as
tourists can obtain visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 3 months. Visa required, except for Nationals of Ukraine traveling on
business can obtain visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 30 days. Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required for their next destination.
Warning: - Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
entry.

Health information - Destination

Zimbabwe (ZW)
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission . Recommended: - Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. falciparum, exists from November through June in the whole country below 1200 m and throughout the year in the Zambezi valley. In Harare and Bulawayo, the risk is negligible. Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.
